projects.title: Initiator SDG Traineeship
projects.description: Het SDG House Network en TheRockGRoup starten een landelijk SDG traineeship programma om 500 jongeren kennis te laten maken, en bieden ervaring met duurzaam en sociaal ondernemen. De jongeren zullen worden opgeleid tot ware ‘SDG-professionals’. Het programma biedt de jongeren een unieke gelegenheid om zichzelf te ontwikkelen en hun carrièrekansen te verbeteren in een groeiende sector van bedrijven die zich inzetten voor het behalen van de Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s) van de Verenigde Naties. Het traineeship zal plaatsvinden bij meer dan honderd opdrachtgevers: bedrijven, start-ups en gemeenten.

contributors.headline: Sustainable Business - Circular Economy - Biodiversity - Regenerative Agriculture

projects.title: Honours Course: Extinction
projects.description:
Extinction is rule. Survival is exception
This phrase uttered by Carl Sagen is meant to illustrate the ruthlessness of nature over geological time frames of millions of years. Probably more than 99% of all species that have ever lived are now extinct. Species have naturally gone extinct for many reasons.
If extinctions have been rule in the past, extinctions are certainly a rule today. With extinction rates exceeding 100 times the baseline rates of non-human eras, as deduced by paleontologists from fossil records, we can assure ourselves that humans play a major role in today’s so called ‘6th mass extinction event’ 
We only recently have become aware of our own influence on the natural world. 
In case of extinction, what exactly is lost? What are the consequences of this loss? How does an ever increasing extinction rate affect ecosystems, and thus the very base of our own livelihoods? Can we substitute the functions that extinct species had? How does extinction affect the economy? How does it affect our psychology and worldview? Why are so many people emotionally attached to species? What can an extinction do to a culture? Do we as a dominant species have the moral obligation to protect - or even bring back from extinction - other species? What is the intrinsic value of a species. What are current strategies to counter extinction? And finally, are we ourselves doomed to go extinct?...and what to think about that?
To these and other questions, we direct our attention during the Honours course we developed for the University of Amsterdam with contributions from lecturers as Redmond O’Hanlon, Jelle Reumer and experts from the Artis Library, Naturalis, IUCN, SeaShepherd.

projects.title: Orange ASEAN
projects.description: Orange ASEAN aims to engage the markets of the future with Dutch innovators. Linking Dutch sustainable companies, eco-designers and social entrepreneurs to their ASEAN counterparts, we work towards enhancing sustainable trade while creating social and environmental value in the ASEAN region.

profile_positions.description:
Maak jij je druk om maatschappelijk issues zoals ongelijkheid of de klimaat crisis? Wil je de wereld positief veranderen en je stem laten horen? Meld je dan nu aan voor Issue Killers via issuekillers.nl!

Het Issue Killers programma is opgezet door TheRockGroup (TRG) en KIT Royal Tropical Institute. In 12 weken ontwikkel je samen met andere jongeren een publieke campagne waarin we laten zien dat de problemen van vandaag belangrijk zijn voor iedereen! En dat we deze problemen kunnen aanpakken, zelfs vandaag!
profile_positions.title: Mede-Oprichter

profile_positions.description:
Supporting organizations to leverage their expertise and resources for sustainable development in an entrepreneurial way. Working with:

- Companies and entrepreneurs on the sustainability of their core-business, improving supply chains, developing new business models, strategic stakeholder engagement 
- Universities on cross-fertilisation of scientific and practical knowledge; developing 21th century education
- Governmental and non-governmental organisations on public private partnerships that generate shared value for shared goals with shared approaches.

www.therockgroup.biz
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description: The ‘fruitbutchers’ of Roze Bunker create local soda's from fresh fruits and herbs. With each of our flavours we aim to address a sustainability issue: producing  high quality products from 'fruit waste' and ensuring that other companies can use our 'waste'  demonstrates how the Circular Economy could work in practice. Sourcing local pro-biodiversity ingredients demonstrates that agriculture and biodiversity can be mutually beneficial. Developing low/no sugar drinks shows and  tasty non-alcoholic alternatives to alcohol offers consumers a healthy alternative when needed.  By using syrup and using high quality tapwater we prevent the unnecessary transport and cooling of water. www.rozebunker.nl
profile_positions.title: Mede-ondernemer

profile_positions.description:
We use education as a tool to regenerate the land

We give young entrepreneurs and students the means to become innovators in the fields of regenerative agriculture and ecosystem restoration.
profile_positions.title: Sustainable Business and Education Advisor

profile_positions.description: The New Amsterdam Council is an independent advisory board consisting of a diverse group of 45 Amsterdam-based experts from education, healthcare, business, the media, science and culture. As an independent representation of a new generation of Amsterdam residents, the New Amsterdam Council meets several times a year to discuss urban issues and formulate unexpected recommendations for policymakers and administrators.
profile_positions.title: New Amsterdam Council

profile_positions.description:
Initiating, organizing & lecturing: 
- Interdisciplinary course on 'Innovation in practice, transitions in the 21th century'
- Professional course 'the value of trade & aid in de sustainable development of agribusiness'
- Interdisciplinary course on Corporate Social Responsibility (for professionals & students)

- Lecturing: Water Governance
- Assisting in the development of the new 'Future Planet Studies' bachelor
profile_positions.title: Coordinator & Lecturer (external)

profile_positions.description:
2018-2019 Part of the team that initiated the new Digital Innovations and Social Change (DISC) bachelor programme on interface of society & technology.

Previously (2012-2017) responsible for the development of a new business oriented graduation track for the science department: The Tesla Minor.

Including initiating & developing partnerships with:
- Different University departments 
- External stakeholders (e.g. TNO, Unilever, Siemens, Friesland Campina, Municipality of Amsterdam, ECN many others)

Tesla is a new minor in which science master students can participate. During the programme, a selected group of students will work on a complex challenge that allows them to utilise their scientific background in a project on the interface of science, business and society.

The programme cuts across traditional boundaries between disciplines and professional environments. Students will attend lectures by speakers from within and outside of the academia, participate in a range of skills trainings, be responsible for the organization parts of the track and work in small groups on a real project for an external corporate partner .

Tesla has the objective to move students out of their academic comfort zone and engage with different types of real challenges. While learning how to manage a project, communicate in different situations and obtain other skills, they will build directly on their scientific background and learn how to use their knowledge to create value in ‘non-science settings’.

Special elements such as an integral sports programme make the Tesla Track an unique learning environment in which students are co-creator of part of their programme.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager Open Innovation (Education)

Vonk is an event in Amsterdam (previously also in Rotterdam, Utrecht and The Hague) during which social and sustainable entrepreneurs are being supported by bringing together the network, ideas and expertise of a broad group of young professionals.

Check our next event on www.vonked.nl, follow us on Twitter or like us on Facebook!
